intro: Languas sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran langus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Sumatra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes various species known for their milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically features elongated, narrow leaves and produces clusters of small, colorful flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
